operator.name: Evergreen Escapes
operator.operatorType: Outdoor tour outfitter offering small group and private guided day tours and multi-day tours from Seattle and Portland, established 2006

products.title: Mt. Rainier National Park Tour
products.shortDescription: Full-day guided small group tour from Seattle to Mt. Rainier National Park featuring waterfall walks, old-growth forests, alpine vistas, wildflower meadows, and wildlife watching.
products.description:
On this day trip from Seattle to Mt. Rainier, savor Mt. Rainier's hidden beauty on foot with waterfall walks, giant trees, alpine vistas, wildflower meadows, and wildlife watching. Stroll through the old-growth forests near Longmire, where Douglas fir, hemlock, and cedar trees dwarf visitors. The bubbling natural springs tell a story of what lies beneath this abundant and volatile landscape. Experience waterfalls and big mountain views as you wind to higher elevations. On summer Mt. Rainier tours (June-Oct), pick wild berries on a sub-alpine hiking trail. On winter tours (Nov-May), take advantage of Paradise's legendary snowfall (and the winter solitude) on an introductory snowshoe trail.

This isn't just another driving tour of a National Park — experience the highlights beyond the vehicle during walks and hikes tailored to your ability. Our guides run the only day tours permitted to explore more than a mile from the park road. Join a few other travelers (each tour is ten people or fewer) and a TripAdvisor 'Hall of Fame' guide on a real exploration of our beautiful home.

Sleep in a little – we're bringing breakfast pastries, local coffee, and tea. Don't waste daylight waiting in line at a busy lunch counter in the National Park – we'll bring a fresh, local, family-style lunch to enjoy with an exceptional view. Replenish with snacks, sparkling water, and water throughout the tour. Don't worry about a thing!
products.pricingNotes: $295 per person plus WA State Taxes. No separate child pricing listed; all participants must be 10+.

ageRestrictions.notes: All tour participants must be 10 years and up.

seasonality.notes: May-Oct: Daily. Nov-April: Saturdays + Mondays. Year-round with summer/winter route variations.

Summer: wild berry picking on sub-alpine trails. Winter: introductory snowshoe trail at Paradise

products.title: 2-Day Mt. Rainier National Park Hiking Tour
products.shortDescription: Two-day guided hiking tour circumnavigating Mt. Rainier with overnight stay at the historic Paradise Inn, featuring epic alpine vistas, old-growth forests, and diverse ecosystems.
products.description:
Lovers of epic vistas, rugged hikes, and wildlife viewing are called to this adventure. We have picked our favorite hikes on different sides of Mt. Rainier to experience all that the famous volcano has to offer—from cascading waterfalls to mammoth old growth forests, panoramic views to ancient glacial ice. We take in incredible vistas and keep our feet moving, exploring the various facets of this geographic landmark and the remarkable terrain which surrounds it.

On this tour, we circumnavigate "The Mountain" (as Mt. Rainier is known to locals), witnessing the highest concentration of glaciers in the continental U.S., and taking time to get to know the residents as we go. Deer, elk, black bear, marmots, and mountain goats abound in the forests and alpine meadows of this high-country wonderland.

Day 1: Journey to Sunrise – hike above the tree-line through open heather and rocky alpine tundra, visit Emmons Glacier and Second Burroughs Mountain. Overnight at historic Paradise Inn with dinner.

Day 2: Hike from Paradise Inn up the flanks of Mt. Rainier toward Camp Muir through wildflowers and berry patches, then descend into lush old growth rainforests on the western slopes with waterfalls and glacial rivers.
products.pricingNotes: $1495 per person based on double occupancy. $300 single supplement for own room. $300 small group supplement per person if fewer than 4 guests.

seasonality.notes: 2026 Dates: August 10-11 and September 17-18. Limited departures.

products.title: Olympic National Park Tour
products.shortDescription: Full-day guided tour from Seattle to Olympic National Park exploring moss-draped forests, azure lakes, old-growth trees, and rugged coastlines via ferry across Puget Sound.
products.description:
Unplug and explore must-see Olympic National Park. Though this 1500 square mile UNESCO World Heritage Site and Biosphere Reserve would take a lifetime to uncover, we dive deep into some of the National Park's natural highlights on this all-inclusive day tour. Join a few other travelers (each tour is ten people or fewer) and an award-winning guide.

Olympic National Park is remarkable for its ecological diversity and expansive wilderness. Our day tour can take one of two routes: Cross the Puget Sound by ferry to the northeast part of the Olympic Peninsula or journey around to the southwest side of the Park to explore some of the quietest corners of the Park. Either way we go, you'll be able to explore the moss-draped forests, azure lakes, old-growth trees, and rugged, rocky coastlines that define the region.

Visit Hurricane Ridge, witness the rebirth of the mighty Elwha river, bask along the shores of glacially-carved Lake Crescent or emerald waters of Lake Quinault, explore rocky shores and tide pools, and feel the mist of cascading waterfalls.

ageRestrictions.notes: All tour participants must be 10 years and up.

seasonality.notes: Year-round. May-Oct: Monday – Saturday. Nov-April: Sundays & Fridays.

faqs.question: Does this tour include snowshoeing in the winter months (November – April)?
faqs.answer: Possibly! Access to Hurricane Ridge is open on Fridays-Sundays for snowshoeing and other winter activities so long as the weather is safe to head up there. If you are interested in snowshoeing, sign up for a Friday departure of a small group tour or reach out about a private tour for Saturday or Sunday. If you would prefer to stay out of the snow, we recommend signing up for the Monday departure.

faqs.question: Does this tour visit the Hoh Rainforest?
faqs.answer: Our day tour to Olympic NP does not visit the Hoh Rainforest because it is about a 4.5 hour drive one way to get there. The ecosystems you will experience at either Lake Crescent or Lake Quinault are very similar to the Hoh region. Lake Quinault is also a temperate rainforest, one of four located in Olympic National Park.

faqs.question: What do I need to bring for this tour? How should I dress?
faqs.answer: There's nothing you need to worry about for this experience other than appropriate clothing attire for the season. We will provide snacks, lunch and beverages so you don't have to worry about a thing. Check out the Pack + Prepare page for info about how to dress based on the season.

faqs.question: What if I'm not staying in Downtown Seattle?
faqs.answer: We have a central Downtown Seattle pickup spot at the Sheraton Grand Hotel or the option to meet at our office where we can provide free off-street parking for guests. Reach out to us to determine which option would be best for you based on where you are coming from and your method of transportation.

products.title: Snoqualmie Falls & Washington Wine Tasting Tour
products.shortDescription: Full-day tour from Seattle combining a nature walk at 270-foot Snoqualmie Falls with behind-the-scenes tastings at boutique Washington wineries.
products.description:
Experience the essence of Washington's wild beauty and independent winemaking on this day tour to Snoqualmie Falls and boutique wineries. Join a few other travelers (each trip is ten people or fewer) and a TripAdvisor 'Hall of Fame' guide on an exploration of Seattle's legendary backyard.

Start your tour at 270-foot-high Snoqualmie Falls, where you'll watch the mighty waters plunge into the river canyon below. After exploring Snoqualmie Falls, you'll explore Washington's viticulture with tastings at two or three local wineries (depending on the season) that deliver on elegance but leave pretense at the door. You'll meet with the passionate winemakers themselves and learn about their journey into the industry. While Washington is the second largest wine-producer in the country, it only exports 1% of its wine!
products.pricingNotes: Prices are per person before WA tax and include tasting fees. Summer: $295 (3 wineries, 10a-6p). Winter: $255 (2 wineries, 10a-4:30p).

ageRestrictions.notes: All tour participants must be 21 and up.

seasonality.notes: Year-round. Summer (May-Oct): Friday & Saturday (small group), Sunday (private). Winter (Nov-April): Saturday & Sunday (small group). Private tours available any day.

faqs.question: What is the difference between this tour in the summer vs winter (and why is there a price difference)?
faqs.answer: During the summer, we explore three different wineries and return to Seattle around 6:00pm. During the winter months (November – April), we visit two Washington wineries and enjoy a more relaxed pace, returning around 4:30pm. The price is adjusted based on the number of tasting fees included and overall length of the experience.

faqs.question: How much walking/hiking should I expect on this tour?
faqs.answer: This experience includes an optional 0.7 mile walk downhill from the upper to lower falls viewing areas. If anyone does not feel comfortable, you can ride back down with the guide and meet the group at the bottom.

faqs.question: How many wineries do we visit?
faqs.answer: From May-October, we visit 3 wineries. From November-April, we visit 2 wineries.

faqs.question: Do you recommend we purchase bottles of wine from the wineries?
faqs.answer: If you find wines you love, we absolutely recommend buying a bottle or two. Only 1% of wine from Washington is exported out of the state, so you will never be able to find these blends back home! Pro-Tip: Most wineries will ship bottles home for you, or if you fly Alaska Airlines, you can check an entire case of wine for free!

faqs.question: Are children allowed to join this tour?
faqs.answer: Since this tour involves alcoholic beverages, all guests must be 21 years or older.

products.title: Best of Portland City Tour
products.shortDescription: Half-day guided tour of Portland exploring the city's highlights including Pittock Mansion, International Rose Test Garden, quirky neighborhoods, and local gourmet doughnuts.
products.description:
In town for a quick visit? Looking for the best possible introductory tour to Portland before you explore on your own? Join a few other travelers (each tour is ten people or fewer) as we seek out the best of Portland.

Our TripAdvisor 'Hall of Fame' guides aim to help you efficiently come to understand Portland by visiting her classic highlights and our off-the-beaten-path favorites. You'll ride in style in a luxe high-roofed van or spacious SUV, hopping out to stroll through parks and neighborhoods.

First, head high for a big view of the city at historic Pittock Mansion. Next, explore Portland's gorgeous green space including the Rose Test Garden. Then dive into its artsy and independent charm walking neighborhoods like the Pearl District, Hawthorne, Nob Hill, Alberta Arts District, or North Mississippi.

seasonality.notes: Schedule not specified on page; appears year-round.

No additional charges — drinks, entrance fees, permits, fuel all covered

products.title: Full Day Whales + Wildlife Watching Tour
products.shortDescription: Full-day tour from Seattle combining Deception Pass State Park exploration with a 3-hour whale watching boat tour through the San Juan Islands searching for orcas, humpbacks, and more.
products.description:
The San Juan Archipelago is made up of 128 named islands, and close to 400 islands in total. It is where the Strait of Juan de Fuca, the Strait of Georgia, and Puget Sound all meet. The fluctuating tide and currents from all directions bring rich nutrients together, providing critical habitat for whales, seals, sea birds, and eagles.

Our journey begins in Downtown Seattle where our comfortable high-roof van picks you up. We travel north to Deception Pass State Park, one of our hidden gems, on par with national parks in both scenery and recreation opportunities. After a delicious picnic lunch we arrive in Anacortes to board our wildlife and whale watching vessel. For the next three hours we will cross channels and go in and out of bays searching for whales and other wildlife.
products.durationDisplay: Memorial Day – Labor Day: 10:00a – 8:30p (10.5 hours). Labor Day – October: 8:30a – 6:30p (10 hours). Return time can vary by up to 30 minutes.

ageRestrictions.notes: All participants must be 8 years and up for small group tour. Children of any age welcome on private tours. Travelers 17 and under must be accompanied by an adult.

seasonality.notes: Memorial Day – September: Sundays, Mondays, Wednesdays & Fridays. October: Sundays & Wednesdays. Private tours available any day.

locations.name: Downtown Seattle
locations.notes: Last pickup at Sheraton Grand Hotel

faqs.question: Is there a group minimum for the tour?
faqs.answer: Yes, we need a minimum of 4 travelers to guarantee a departure.

faqs.question: How should I dress for this tour?
faqs.answer: Please dress in comfortable clothing with sturdy walking shoes or boots. You will need warm layers as it can be 15-20 degrees cooler on the water even in summer. We recommend a warm jacket, hats and gloves and a rain or waterproof coat. We offer complimentary raincoats, hats and gloves upon request with 24 hours notice.

faqs.question: Is the whale watching service provided by Evergreen Escapes?
faqs.answer: We partner with Outer Island Excursions, an expert in providing first class whale watching and water-based activities around the Salish Sea.

faqs.question: Is gratuity included in the price of the tour?
faqs.answer: No, your tour price covers all logistics and supplies but does not include gratuity for your guides. We encourage you to consider leaving both your guide and your boat captain a monetary gratuity.

faqs.question: Is there an age minimum for this tour?
faqs.answer: All travelers must be at least 8 years or older for the small group tour, but travelers of any age are welcome on private tours. Travelers 17 and under must be accompanied by an adult.

faqs.question: How long is the whale watching boat ride?
I get really seasick, should I join this tour?
faqs.answer: This tour spends 3-4 hours on a highspeed boat in the Salish Sea. If you are extremely prone to seasickness, we generally do not recommend this tour.

faqs.question: How many people will be on the whale watching boat?
faqs.answer: Our group will join a public whale watching boat provided by Outer Island Excursions. Depending on the day, the boat holds 30-80 people in total.
